etymology.description: Phonetic: 叀(叀) -> Originally written as 叀; Semantic: 心(心)
etymology.interpretation: The character 惠(惠) (huì, 'kind') combines 叀(叀) for its phonetic value with 心(心) (xīn, 'heart') to suggest the idea of kindness or benevolence, indicating an expression of heartfelt actions.
etymology.simplification: 惠(惠) was simplified to 恵(惠) by changing 叀(叀) to 𤰔 for a more streamlined form.

examples.chinese: 政府推出了惠民政策(政府推出了惠民政策)，改善了老百姓的生活(改善了老百姓的生活)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ tuīchū le huìmín zhèngcè, gǎishàn le lǎobǎixìng de shēnghuó.
examples.english: The government introduced benefit policies, improving the lives of the people.

examples.chinese: 她以慈惠之心帮助邻居(她以慈惠之心幫助鄰居)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐ cí huì zhī xīn bāngzhù línjū.
examples.english: She helps her neighbors with a kind heart.

examples.chinese: 他的行为充满了惠意(他的行為充滿了惠意)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xíngwéi chōngmǎn le huì yì.
examples.english: His actions are filled with kindness.
